items.summary: The easing of US tariffs is a clear positive for India after a long spell of trade uncertainty. Its energy component could impact global markets for hydrocarbons. Still, we await the fine print of this deal on agricultural items that had been sticky points of negotiation.

items.title: Bajaj Auto January sales rise 25% at 4,77,422 units

items.title: Varun Beverages Q4 results: Net profit rises 33% to  ₹260 crore;  ₹0.50 dividend declared

items.title: Former RBI official R Gandhi backs Budget 2026's medium-term vision, defends STT hike on F&O trading
items.summary: Former RBI Deputy Governor R Gandhi backs the Union Budget 2026's long-term economic vision. He highlights tax stability as key for investor confidence. Gandhi also explains the Securities Transaction Tax hike aims to curb speculation, not hinder price discovery. This approach supports India's Viksit Bharat 2047 goals, fostering a sustainable investment climate.

items.title: Liberation Day: India’s journey from Trump tariff threats to US trade triumph
items.summary: India-US trade deal: India and the United States have reached a significant trade agreement. This deal concludes months of intense negotiations. The agreement includes reduced tariffs on Indian goods. It also sees the removal of punitive tariffs. This marks a major milestone for both nations. The pact is expected to boost Indian exports. It underscores India's strategic approach to international trade.

items.summary: India and the US have reached a breakthrough trade deal, significantly easing global uncertainty for India's trade outlook. The agreement, announced by President Trump, includes a sharp reduction in US tariffs on Indian goods to 18% and withdrawal of penal levies on Russian oil purchases.

items.summary: India's neighbourhood policy is adapting to complex regional shifts.  Geopolitical competition and internal changes in neighbouring nations demand tailored approaches.  A recent dialogue and book highlight the need for differentiated engagement, moving beyond a one-size-fits-all strategy.  Focusing on country-specific needs and building trust are crucial for regional stability and India's influence.

This trade agreement signals improved India-US relations and supports India's export ambitions.

Patient groups welcome the relief for out-of-pocket expenses. However, some believe duty cuts alone will not make these drugs affordable for most Indians. The proposal also includes duty waivers on anti-cancer drugs.

items.title: Reliance's Jio Studios’ acquires 50.1% stake in Sikhya Entertainment
items.summary: Reliance Industries' subsidiary, RSBVL, has acquired a 50.1% stake in Sikhya Entertainment for ₹150 crore, bolstering Jio Studios' presence in the media and entertainment sector. This strategic partnership aims to combine Jio Studios' scale and distribution with Sikhya's award-winning storytelling to co-create films and series for global audiences.

items.title: Rs 12 lakh crore added! Sensex rockets 2,000 pts, Nifty tops 25,700 on India-US trade deal and 4 other factors
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex surged significantly following a long-awaited trade deal between India and the US. The agreement, which includes reduced reciprocal tariffs, has eased concerns that had impacted the market. A strengthening rupee further supported domestic assets, boosting investor sentiment and market capitalisation.

items.title: Trump tariffs: How India fares against China, Pakistan and Japan post India-US trade deal
items.summary: Here's how tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump on India fare against other countries after he rolled back punitive duties for purchase of Russian oil. The cut comes after eight months of trade tensions between the two countries.&nbsp;

items.title: Former SBI Chief Dinesh Kumar Khara joins Truhome Finance
items.summary: Truhome Finance has appointed former SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara as its new chairperson for a five-year term. Khara, instrumental in SBI's major mergers, brings extensive experience from leadership roles in global banking, risk management, and IT. His appointment signals a significant development for the mortgage lender.

items.title: Piramal Finance Retail CEO to lead IndusInd Bank's consumer business
items.summary: Jagdeep Mallareddy, currently CEO of retail lending at Piramal Finance, is set to join IndusInd Bank to lead its consumer finance business. This strategic hire by CEO Rajiv Anand is crucial for the bank's retail growth plans. Mallareddy, who previously worked with Anand at Axis Bank, will oversee both asset and liability sides of retail banking.

items.title: US-India trade deal to benefit businesses, workers, consumers of both countries: US-India Strategic Partnership Forum
items.summary: The US-India Strategic Partnership Forum has lauded the new trade deal, anticipating significant gains for businesses and consumers. This initial step, reducing India's reciprocal tariff, signals strong political will for a comprehensive agreement. Both nations aim to boost supply chains and economic resilience, with further negotiations expected to expand bilateral trade towards a $500 billion target.

items.title: Reading between the lines of Budget 2026: What it signals for markets, growth and key sectors
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 aims to accelerate economic growth while balancing fiscal prudence. Key highlights include a rise in STT, TCS relief for travellers, Rs 12.2 lakh crore Capex, incentives for IT, semiconductor, and BioPharma sectors, and a focus on digital and physical infrastructure. The budget supports markets, growth, and sectoral expansion.

items.title: Centre, RBI weigh linking UPI with Singapore’s Alipay+ for cross-border payments
items.summary: India is considering a proposal to link its Unified Payments Interface (UPI) with Singapore's Alipay+ to facilitate cross-border digital payments. This potential integration would allow seamless transactions for Indian travelers abroad and vice-versa. The decision hinges on a thorough evaluation of data security, IT system safeguarding, and geopolitical considerations.

items.title: Why hospitals are targeting health insurance buyers
items.summary: Companies such as PB Health and Even Healthcare are combining healthcare with insurance, betting that tighter control over care delivery can make insurance viable at scale.

items.title: Q3 results today: Bajaj Finance, Adani Ports among 111 companies to report earnings on Tuesday
items.summary: Bajaj Finance is poised for a strong Q3FY26 earnings report. Analysts anticipate robust growth in net interest income and profit after tax. This performance is expected to be fueled by consistent loan book expansion and stable profit margins. Credit costs are also projected to see a gradual improvement.

items.summary: Air India has grounded a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner after a pilot reported a fuel control switch failure during engine start-up. The aircraft was en route from London to Bengaluru. This incident follows heightened scrutiny of fuel control switches after a fatal Air India Dreamliner crash last year.

items.summary: US-India deal: India and the US have agreed to a trade deal, with Washington reducing tariffs on Indian goods to 18%. This move, welcomed by EAM Jaishankar, aims to boost job creation, economic growth, and the 'Make in India' initiative. The agreement also involves India ceasing Russian oil purchases.

items.summary: India, US trade: India and the United States have finalized a significant trade agreement. This deal promises to boost opportunities for farmers, MSMEs, and entrepreneurs. It will facilitate technology transfer from the US to India, accelerating India's journey towards Viksit Bharat 2047. The agreement also opens doors for 'Make in India' and 'Design in India' initiatives for the global market.

items.title: Thank the Finance Commission for a tax-sharing formula tilt that promotes better state-level fiscal policy
items.summary: The 16th Finance Commission’s report makes a small but significant shift in how states should share India’s common tax pool. It tilts the formula of horizontal devolution towards growth and incentivizes better fiscal management by states.

items.summary: India, US trade deal announcement: The US and India have reached a trade deal, with Washington reducing tariffs on Indian goods to 18%. This agreement is seen as a significant confidence-building measure after a year of strained relations. While hailed as a major victory, key details regarding energy imports and market access remain unclear.

items.summary: In the Union Budget for FY27, the government announced plans to accredit more than 1,000 clinical trial sites to speed up drug development. Whether it works will depend on manpower and regulatory capacity.

items.title: India "earned" tariff relief by recalibrating Russian oil purchases, claims US Senator Graham
items.summary: US Senator Lindsey Graham on Monday (local time) claimed that India has "earned" the reduction in tariffs under the newly announced India-US trade deal, linking the move to the decrease in Russian oil purchases by New Delhi amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

items.title: Indian refiners await government advice on Russian oil import halt, sources say
items.summary: Indian refiners have not received government orders to cease Russian oil purchases, despite a recent trade deal with the U.S. While some refiners have paused new orders and are preparing to scale back imports, existing February and March cargoes are expected to be completed. A complete halt would significantly impact operations at the Russia-backed Nayara Energy refinery.

items.title: India gets tariff advantage over China, Pakistan & Bangladesh in US trade deal
items.summary: India, US trade deal: India now enjoys a significant trade advantage with the United States. Washington has reduced tariffs on Indian products to 18 percent. This move places India ahead of regional export rivals like Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Vietnam. The deal also sees India's tariffs on US goods reduced. This development is a major boost for Indian exports and strengthens bilateral trade ties.

items.title: Budget 2026: DEA Secy asks companies to invest in critical sectors
items.summary: The government, Anuradha Thakur said, intends to stay on the fiscal consolidation path and reduce its debt-to-GDP ratio. This will weigh down the Centre's borrowing costs and free up resources for priority sector spending, Thakur said at a post-budget event, organised by the Confederation of Indian Industry.

items.title: HAL's civil aviation plans take off, company eyes commercial market
items.summary: State-owned HAL is shifting focus to the commercial aviation market. The company aims for 25% of its revenue from this sector within five years. HAL plans to leverage aircraft like the SJ-100 and Hindustan-228 for this expansion. This move is supported by government incentives for local aircraft manufacturing. HAL is also collaborating with Russian firms for aircraft production and leasing.

items.title: Need for inclusive credit strategies for unbanked population: DFS secretary to banks
items.summary: New initiatives aim to boost credit access for the unbanked. The BAANKNET app and Digital Balance Confirmation Platform were launched to streamline property auctions and audits. The PSB Alliance is encouraged to broaden its services. These steps support financial inclusion and efficiency. India's banking sector shows robust health with declining NPAs and steady credit growth.

items.title: PF exemptions to now align in full with EPFO rules
items.summary: The Union Budget proposes changes to provident fund trust rules. These changes aim to simplify business operations and reduce legal disputes. Employer contributions to provident funds will no longer need to match employee contributions. Tax on employer contributions exceeding 12% of wages is also being removed.

items.title: Microfinance companies fail to get budget-day wish, hope to bask in others' sunlight
items.summary: Budget 2026: The microfinance sector did not receive budget credit guarantee support. However, it anticipates that proposals aimed at increasing rural incomes will enhance the repayment capacity of its customers. Focus on fisheries, animal husbandry, and high-value agriculture through credit-linked programs is expected to strengthen income diversification.

items.title: Budget 2026: Push on carbon capture boosts confidence of steel, cement makers
items.summary: India's government is investing Rs 20,000 crore over five years in carbon capture technology. This funding will aid hard-to-abate industries like steel and cement. These sectors face high emissions and significant costs for low-carbon solutions. The move signals strong policy support for industrial decarbonisation. It aims to help these industries meet climate goals while expanding production capacity.

items.title: Budget 2026: Tax reforms mark shift to trust-based regime, says CBDT chief
items.summary: Explaining the hike in securities transaction tax (STT) on derivatives, CBDT chairman Ravi Agrawal said that the reforms regarding the minimum alternative tax (MAT) will push more companies to the new tax regime, adding that the government will honour all accumulated MAT credit up to March 31 for companies shifting to the new 22% tax regime.

items.title: In temple run from Varanasi to Sikkim, faith's in fast lane
items.summary: India's spiritual travel sector is poised for significant growth. The government is investing heavily in temple towns and Buddhist circuits. New high-speed rail corridors will connect major pilgrimage sites. This focus on infrastructure and amenities will attract more travelers, including families and experience seekers, to destinations like Ayodhya and Varanasi.

items.title: Priority is growth; demand seen keeping up pace, says Nirmala Sitharaman after Budget 2026
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is confident consumption will remain strong. She defended the increased tax on derivative trading, aiming to deter speculation. The government plans to boost disinvestment and asset monetisation to fund its fiscal goals. Amendments to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code are also planned for the latter half of the budget session.

items.title: A quiet confidence: How India’s Budget steadies the economy in a turbulent world
items.summary: India's latest budget reflects a quiet confidence in navigating global economic shifts.  The nation's economic foundations are firm, with strong growth expected.  Fiscal discipline is evident, with a clear path to reduce debt.  Reforms continue to improve the ease of doing business.  The corporate bond market is being deepened.  These measures signal India's readiness for global investment and financial integration.

items.title: Govt's support to put homes within reach of more people
items.summary: Home loan demand is set for a significant boost. The Union Budget has sharply increased subsidy allocations for key housing schemes. This move will directly improve affordability and credit uptake, especially for first-time homebuyers and lower-income households. Housing finance companies anticipate a more sustainable demand environment. The schemes will also generate employment during construction.

items.title: Newer models, sharper pricing help EV market shift to top gear in Jan
items.summary: India's electric passenger vehicle market saw a 51% year-on-year surge in January 2026 sales, reaching 18,059 units. While Tata Motors maintained leadership, its market share declined as Mahindra & Mahindra and newcomer VinFast gained significant ground. This shift highlights intensifying competition driven by new models and improved infrastructure.

items.title: No India-Pak game: JioStar faces a 15–20% hit to total advertisement revenue for the T20 World Cup
items.summary: A cricket match between India and Pakistan is a highly anticipated event, driving significant advertising revenue due to its large viewership. Brands often align their major advertising campaigns with the Cricket World Cup, specifically targeting the India-Pakistan game. JioStar aims to generate over Rs 2,000 crore in advertising revenue from the tournament across television and digital platforms. The absence of an India-Pakistan match could result in an estimated revenue loss of up to 20%. Subscription revenue is not expected to be affected, as these agreements are typically annual and involv

items.title: Mirchi named radio partner for Men's T20 World Cup 2026

items.title: NCLT admits Smaaash Leisure into insolvency

The company failed to repay its dues, leading to the application by JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction. The National Company Law Tribunal has appointed an interim resolution professional to manage the process. This development follows a loan default in December 2020.

items.title: Auto sales surge as tax cuts fuel demand momentum
items.summary: This marked the fourth straight month of a double-digit growth in domestic car sales. Car sales grew by 17% in October, 19% in November, and 27% in December, as consumers rushed to showrooms to benefit from price cuts on cars and SUVs following a reduction in goods and services tax (GST) with effect from September 22.

items.title: English news channel Times Now marks 20 years with special programmes
items.summary: English news channel Times Now celebrates 20 years of operations, marking the milestone with curated conversations featuring prominent figures from politics, sport, and entertainment. items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
